FacilityName: Upstate Niagara Cooperative, Inc.  Fulton Facility

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary

Upstate Niagara Cooperative, Inc.'s Fulton facility (Fulton) produces various dairy products at our facility located in Rochester, NY. The Fulton facility has a strong commitment to operate our facility in a safe and responsible manner. Ammonia is used at our facility as the cooling medium in our refrigeration system. The ammonia is contained in a closed loop system; it is designed to remain inside the piping and vessels in our facility. We believe that ammonia provides the safest and most efficient cooling choice for our operation.



A. Describe the Accident Release Prevention and Emergency Policies

Fulton takes many precautions to prevent or minimize accidental releases of ammonia from the refrigeration system. These precautions include safety controls (alarms and automatic shutdown devices) which are designed to identify and prevent potentially unsafe conditions like pressure increases that could cause a system failure. Fulton also has a preventive maintenance program designed to maintain the ongoing integrity of the systems, a training program designed to ensure that the systems are operated by qualified personnel, and emergency procedures that enable trained personnel to respond quickly to system upsets. The PSM/RMP Coordinator is responsible for the management of these ammonia safety programs.



B. Stationary Source and Regulated Substances Handled - Ammonia is the only substance covered by the Accidental Release Prevention Regulations handled at this facility.



C. Description of the Accidental Release Prevention Program

The facility has an accident release prevention program that complies with Occupational Safety and Health Administration's Process Safety Management Standard and EPA's Risk Management Program Rule. The prevention program consists of the following elements:

Employee Participation Program

Process Safety Information

Process Hazard Analysis

Operating Procedures

Training Program

Contractor Safety Program

Pre-Startup

Safety Review Procedures

Mechanical Integrity Program

Hot Work Permit Procedures

Management of Change Procedures

Incident Investigation Procedures

Compliance Audit Procedures



D. Five-Year Accident History

The facility has not had any releases in the past 5 years meeting the criteria for inclusion in the 5 year accident history.



E. Description of the Emergency Response Program

An Emergency Action Plan (EAP) has been implemented at the facility. The EAP contains procedures describing how the facility will respond to ammonia spills and other emergencies, including evacuation procedures. The program has been coordinated with local response agencies. 



F. Planned Changes to Improve Safety

We have identified potential changes to improve the safety of our ammonia refrigeration system. All potential changes are documented through meeting notes and/or action lists associated with the PSM/RMP Program.
